input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: CEO has a direct effect on director and manager. Manager has a direct effect on employee. Director has a direct effect on employee. The overall probability of manager signing the termination letter is 86%. The probability of manager not signing the termination letter and employee being fired is 4%. The probability of manager signing the termination letter and employee being fired is 60%. Is the chance of employee being fired larger when observing manager signing the termination letter?
